subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Night Photography with a 35mm
author: Elabeth
full_text:
It isn't in any kind of special box or anything. It's just connected
to either earphones, some little ipod type speakers or the digital
recorder. I've had it connected up to all those things.

On Mon, Aug 11, 2008 at 6:28 PM, Chad Wiggins <cawiggins78@...> wrote:
>
> How do you have the 469 set up?
>
> ----- Original Message ----
> From: Elizabeth <elabeth@...>
> To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
> Sent: Monday, August 11, 2008 7:05:04 PM
> Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: Night Photography with a 35mm
>
> YES. Actually, getting the flash as far away from the lens as possible
> plus either bouncing it off the ceiling or using a diffuser will
> almost eliminate dust orbs. A speedlite flash is well worth the $$.
>
> To make this a little more on topic, I have a 469 radio shack hack
> unit. I've tried it a few times and haven't received any messages at
> all yet. I've even tried just letting it run for a while while I'm
> doing other things and haven't gotten anything. I guess there isn't
> anyone around who wants to talk to me :( Do you know of anything I can
> do to try to drum up some conversation?
>
> Elabeth
>
